Articles.Content:
Not sure about the broom handle aesthetic.

From: https://lq.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/3km3k3/new_part_for_11_revealed_on_squadcast/
I think its fine Tantares has something similar for its stockalike soyuz replica
These are going to make fun catapults.
Not gonna lie, that looks bloody ugly
If broomsticks can be used as fake tail-guns in WWII war planes, then broomsticks can be used in antennas as well.
What happended to the realistic, space probe-ish antennas? No please don't shelf those, SQUAD.
I think the reason these 'antenna' exist is because its kinda hard to fit a reasonable sized fairing around them when attached radially.
The model itself is ok, I'm just not a big fan of the colour scheme.

What happended to the realistic, space probe-ish antennas? No please don't shelf those, SQUAD.

not that unrealistic is it?

To y'all, who think antenna is ugly and stuff.

Go tell that to NASA guys.

not that unrealistic is it?

Okay I know what really, what happened to the other ones?
I like it, and am looking forward to being encouraged to use it - and any other antenna but the default one you start with.
Sorry about being a persistent ....., but what happened to these?

Beware, ye foul space monsters, for I shall unleash upon thee the mighty Space Frying Pan of Doom +5!

- famous last words from Anti Kraken Expedition XVIII

Sorry about being a persistent ....., but what happened to these?

http://i.imgur.com/7txNuML.png

They're still going to be in the game, I assume. There are going to be lots of different antenna for different purposes.

The three you saw before (and reposted above) are your relay antennas. The new antenna is very small (0.5m diameter dish) and as many folks have noted, a kerbalized version of real antenna with features/homage to the hubble, apollo, and soyuz.

(edit)

So without going into too much detail (NDAs and such), the little foldable one you see in this post is meant to complement the other deployable antennas (i.e. the three existing ones you have in game now, only two of which actually have dishes).

(double edit)

And all of this is because once the antenna diversity feature is in, just plunking a whip antenna on your ship and calling it a day will no longer cut it So I need to make sure we have an appropriate stable of antennas available in stock to support the feature and it's mechanics.

Edited September 12, 2015 by RoverDude
AhI see, thanks for the info.

"Broomstick" antenna will be useful as it can be folded on service module/station or be used as small relay antennas, independent with larger hull mounted ones. There is a place for all types and sizes.

And all of this is because once the antenna diversity feature is in, just plunking a whip antenna on your ship and calling it a day will no longer cut it So I need to make sure we have an appropriate stable of antennas available in stock to support the feature and it's mechanics.

Please tell me it will be very clear in-game which antenna to pick for what purpose. "We don't know what this is for" and "We found this in the dumpster out back" is amusing and all but I'd rather have "this dish will reach out to Jool at its closest approach, and everywhere in Duna's orbit" or something similar.

- - - Updated - - -

"Broomstick" antenna will be useful as it can be folded on service module/station or be used as small relay antennas, independent with larger hull mounted ones. There is a place for all types and sizes.

I foresee "you cannot use this antenna while it is stowed" messages

The three you saw before (and reposted above) are your relay antennas. The new antenna is very small (0.5m diameter dish) and as many folks have noted, a kerbalized version of real antenna with features/homage to the hubble, apollo, and soyuz.

(edit)

So without going into too much detail (NDAs and such), the little foldable one you see in this post is meant to complement the other deployable antennas (i.e. the three existing ones you have in game now, only two of which actually have dishes).

(double edit)

And all of this is because once the antenna diversity feature is in, just plunking a whip antenna on your ship and calling it a day will no longer cut it So I need to make sure we have an appropriate stable of antennas available in stock to support the feature and it's mechanics.

Looks and sounds awesome. Keep up the good work.

In response to some of the posts in here:

I'm not getting the broomstick comparison. Is it just because it's no a pole?

Why would this reveal, in any way, mean the former reveals are no longer going to be in the game?

Also, I think it looks fine.

Not gonna lie, that looks bloody ugly

They all look ugly, bulky and dirty, the latest one isn't an exception. It's like a disfigured brother of the AIES set.

They all look ugly, bulky and dirty, the latest one isn't an exception. It's like a disfigured brother of the AIES set.

Coming from the guy who wanted to keep the ugly, jagged, dirty old mk1 cockpit

Efficiency has the priority IMO and AIES iirc predates the texture sharing trend so I don't think it's a fair comparison. Also AIES parts are so shiny they look like plastic to me.

And even on top of that this new one doesn't look ugly to me I think it's everyone's knee jerk reaction to the darker color scheme.
I think it would look fine if they just made it white instead of dark gray.

They all look ugly, bulky and dirty, the latest one isn't an exception. It's like a disfigured brother of the AIES set.

Very constructive criticism...

[...]Efficiency has the priority IMO and AIES iirc predates the texture sharing trend so I don't think it's a fair comparison. Also AIES parts are so shiny they look like plastic to me.[...]

I think texture sharing is of utmost importance to keep that memory footprint low!
